info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 5:29AM MST until January 08 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph may cause temporary white-out conditions in blowing snow. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet, Central Grant County/Silver City Area and Southern Gila Region Highlands/Black Range. * WHEN...From 5 PM Sunday to 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility overnight. Drifting snow may temporarily close roads. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and damage outdoor objects. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Best chance for snow will occur along and behind the cold front, between 4-10PM for the Gila Region and 8PM-2AM for the Sacramento Mountains.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
